content:
I compiled a list of more than 80 glacier files that trigger an ICE on stable rustc in some way.
Should I apply the regression-from-stable-to-stable label to all of them (if they don't have it already?)
This would probably cause a flood of notifications in the -alerts channel
@matthiaskrgr you should ask in #t-compiler/wg-prioritization I think
oh oops I thought this was t-compiler/help lmao

do we have a definition for "regression"?
is "compiler rejected this code" => "internal compiler panic on this code" a regression?
I think so, but I thought glacier was added to on ICEs only? I would want a version where it didn't ICE I think before tagging as a regression
I see :+1:
And also: please try to not do too many at a time or you'll overwhelm us :sweat_smile:

I was wondering if this list of regression should be assigned a priority label - @Santiago Pastorino (and others) what's your opinion? Just to see if there is anything critical in any of those regresssions.
Are these issues already all filed in the issue tracker @matthiaskrgr ?
if not (or if not all of them are already filed) I was thinking if it could make sense a quick review of them, assign a priority, then file them in the issue tracker with already a priority
reason is that many of ICE issues might end up with a P-medium priority label, meaning they're under the radar but do not require immediate attention
looks like all of the current rustc-repo stable ICES are known, a couple of them have notes inside the test that this causes an ICE under some circumstances
ok, so they are under control, thanks :thumbs_up:
